comments:
Attempted to open a .Doc file w/ "Open Default Editor", which attempts to 
launch MS Word 2000 inside eclipse (OLE Editor).  

A window opens inside eclipse for the doc, but window is grayed out, and 
contains the text "An error has occurred when creating this editor".  

MS Word launches fine if eclispe is used to Open With System Editor (outside 
eclipse).  Other users verify that this feature (launching MS Word as OLE 
editor) works fine for MSWord 97.

Log file contains:

Tod, could you please investigate.
Chris, which build were you using, and which version of NT?

This looks to me like your install of Word failed to execute the OLE call - I 
don't think there is anything Eclipse can do about this. cc'ed SWT for further 
comment.

The error is 0x80004002  -2147467262  No such interface supported

It would appear that the OleDocument for Word may not be properly installed.

Can you try this test:
    Open Power Point (not in eclispe just from the desktop)
    Create a new power point presentation, click in it and then 
    select Insert -> Object from the menubar.  
    Select Microsoft Word Document from the list and hit the OK button.

Does a Word Document get inserted for you?

I am running with Microsoft Word 2000(9.0.3821 SR-1).  Occassionally I get 
prompted to install a patch but I ignore this message (hit cancel in the 
dialog) and things work fine.

Inserting the Ole document into PowerPoint worked fine.  

I am using MS Word 2000 9.0.3821 SR-1, and Eclipse build 20011219.
Defer as this is an issue with the Word OLE interface.
Closing PR as this is not an Eclipse issue.

traces.message: Failed to find requested interface on OLE Object.  result = -2147467262
